channel.title: PostgreSQL Initialization on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in PostgreSQL Initialization on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Initialize Postgres from WAL
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Don’t know how to take continuous backup? Check tutorial on Continuous Archiving. PostgreSQL Initialization from WAL files KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. When you create a new Postgres object, you can provide existing WAL files to restore from by “replaying” the log entries. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: Initialize Postgres using Script Source
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Initialize PostgreSQL with Script KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to initialize a PostgreSQL database from script. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using minikube.

item.title: Initialize Postgres using Snapshot Source
item.description: Don’t know how backup works? Check tutorial on Instant Backup. Initialize PostgreSQL with Snapshot KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to initialize a PostgreSQL database with existing snapshot data. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using minikube.
